titleStmt.title: luther part 1 info from letters fixed

availability.p: Copyright Â© 2018, Christopher Alan Mosher, Shelton, Connecticut, USA.
availability.licence: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

correction.p: OCR generated transcript has not been corrected.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

body.ab:
Christopher A. Mosher
42 Ridgeley Avenue
Fairfield, CT 06430-4408
September 10, 1993
Hello, Emory,
I'm sorry I haven't written you back sooner. And after you've written me so many
wonderful letters! After doing some more research, 1 have convinced myself that the
George W. Luther that you are descended from is the brother of the Angalina and
Mary Luther that 1 am descended from. 1 also think that the Gideon Luther you
mentioned is another brother in that family. 1 have also run accross a Martha Luther
who is a sister of these all. The approximate birth dates are: Gideon clSlS, Mary
1824, Angalina 1807, Martha ?, and George W. 1815. The parents of these siblings
still remain a mystery!
1 was able to find George W. in a couple of the US Censuses. The 1850 US Census
shows him in Chatham, Tioga Co., PA with his wife Catherine and children George
Jr. (age 5), and Martin (age 3). In 1860, 1 found the same family in Deerfield, Tioga
Co. This time, there were three more children, Augusta, James, and Alonzo. The
ages of George and Catherine are incorrect, though. In 1850, George is listed as 45,
and in 1860 he is also listed as 45! Caterine is listed as 43 in 1850, but in I860, she is
listed as 32, that's 10 years later, but 11 years younger! So there is confusion as to the
correct dates of birth.
There are two George "W. Luthers (father and son) listed in Luther Family in America
who at first glance seem likely candidates for our George, but 1 am sure that neither
one is him. There are too many inconsistencies between our George's family and the
ones listed in the book. There are enough similarities, however, for me to think that
they are related in some way. With a lot of searching and a little luck, 1 think we can
tie our family into the Luthers in the book somehow.
Please let me know if you find out anything about the parents of George W. Luther!
Sincerely,
Chris Mosher
l!
403 North Buckeye
Coffeyville, Kansas
67337
November 20, 1992
Christopher A. Mosher
42 Ridgeley Avenue
Fairfield, Ct. 06430-4408
Dear Mr. Mosher:
I received your letter of 3, November and have been searching
through all my Mosher material for any reference to Luther.
I have the book "Decendants Of Hugh Mosher and Rebecca Maxon
Through Seven Generations" and the later Revised Edition written by
Mildred Chamberlain and Laura Clarenbach. I have corresponded with
Laura for several years, actually before they finished the book,
but we have not been able to find a place for my Isaac Mosher born
1807-8 .
When I wrote to George Luther, of the Luther Family Assoc. We
had been working on the assumption that my Isaac could be the son
of David 5, Mosher (1780-1862). At that time we had two sons who
were unnamed and thought they might be Isaac and his brother
Ellither (Ellether, Lute, Lete). Then later Laura established the
name of one of the sons and it was not Isaac or Ellither. I was so
disappointed. I had thought surely this was where he belonged
because Isaac named his first son Isaac for himself, and the second
son he named David.
I have a notation here from Laura which reads:
In 1850 census David,age 69 and wife Sarah were with son Wm. G. and
family. In same household were as follows:
B. (listed under Mosher)? age 57 born Canada. He may be B.Luther,
Gideon Luther age 32 born N.Y. evidently brother of Wm Gs wife Mary
age 36. If really B. Luther he was probably Mary's Father.
Children of David and Betsy:
3 sons born between 1800-10C^-41 3 daughters born between 1800-10
1 son born 1810-20 2 daughters born between 1810-20
1 son born 1825-30 1 daughter born 1820-25
The only son who was positively identified is William G. born ca
1807 Saratoga; died May 19, 1900 S. Hamilton, Madison Co. N.Y.
Death records identify parents as David and betsy.
William G. married ffl Mary Luther and #2 Angelina Luther.
One of David's daughters may have been Betsy D. of Greenfield who
was admitted to the baptist church in Wyoming Co., 1837 died 1841
(Foley 4-6: 437).
2 .
A very probable son was Rensselear Seneca or (S.R.) born 1817 died
1893 and is buried in Niles Valley Cemetery, Tioga Co. Pa. He lived
Oswego, Tioga Co. N.Y.1840. Deerfield Tioga Co Pa. 1850-60. Chatham
Tioga Co. Pa 1870. The Archives copy of the 1870 census evidently
read Seneca as Horace. For wife and children the same as copied.
He married Martha Luther, (note: wives of Wm. G. Mosher born 1821
N.Y. died 1894 are buried in the same cemetery.
Children of Rennsealer:
Elizabeth born 1844 N.Y., Mary A. born 1846 N.y. William born 1848
Pa. Harvey 1849-50 Pa. Franklin 1856 Pa. Eddy (?) 1859 Pa.
The madison County N.Y. probate for Angeline Mosher September 19,
1870, (A 572 file 3027 ) of Hamilton. She had no children so her
heirs were siblings, or if her heirs were deceased, then their
children. A newspaper clipping lists heirs as brother George W.
Luther of Knoxville Pa. Sister Martha Mosher of knoxville Pa. and
Eliza Jane Stevens of Stevens Point, Wisconsin.
Petition for administration named as children of deceased sister
Mary Mosher, David Mosher, Julia Ann Douglas, Sarah mosher, Willie
Mosher age 16 all of Hamilton. William G. Mosher was served the
citat i on.
The will of William G. Mosher age 86 (May 20, 1893 named daughter
Julia A. Douglas exec, and son David Mosher.
You may already have all of the above, but I hope some of it
may help you. If I run across any more I will pass it on to you.
I have been stuck in one place for so long that it seems I may
never find the parents of Isaac- In his probate packet in Ottawa
County Kansas I found an old deed dated 1841, Mendon, Monroe co.
N.Y.Ellither was listed on the deed with him, which caused me to
believe they were brothers, though I have no actual proof of that.
They purchased two lots together. Both had children born in the
town of Mendon. Then by 1850 Isaac and wife Dorcas (Bennet) were in
the town of Perinton, Monroe Co. N.Y. By 1860 they were in
Winnebago Co. Wisconsin and bought property there. Dorcas must have
died right after 1860 census, because Isaac remarried to Lucy
Brando. He was in Kansas by 1865 without Lucy, and died here 1877,
Ottawa County, Kansas. In every census record he states that he was
born N.Y and his parents were born N.Y. Ellither states that he was
born Saratogatown, must be Saratoga county, though I have found
nothing further to prove or disprove this. I tried to get the death
cert, for Ellither. He was alive in 18 9 2, but I didn't know the
exact date. The vital records office in N.Y.raised their search fee
and I just couldn't afford to keep paying them to search. We feel
certain Ellither died South Br i stnl . N.Y. but didn't get D. Cert.
Would appreciate any help you may give me. Sincerely, Jean Robison.

PRESIDENT
Allcene Luther Withers
3 Rockridge Road
Oroville, CA 95966
VICE PRESIDENT
Bradford W. Luther, Jr.
Post Office Box 225
Fairhaven, MA 02719
2Ii|c iCutfier JFamtlo AHBOciation
2531 LAKEVIEW STREET
LAKELAND, FLORIDA 33801
813 / 665-5788
SECRETARY
George A. Luther
2531 Lakeview Street
Lakeland, FL 33801
TREASURER
Lucile L. Luther
2531 Lakeview Street
Lakeland, PL 33801
Christopher A. Mosher
42 Ridgeley Avenue
Falrfield, Connecticut 06430
October 29, 1992
Dear Christopher,
The Luther Family in America appears to discuss only one Luther family in the
Saratoga area, that of Gideon, page 154. But there could well have been a
second one there for the period we're concerned with.
It seems unlikely that your Mary, Angalina, George, and Martha could have come
from my Gideon; his first wife, Olive Fowler, died in Rhode Island in 1785,
before they were born. With his second wife, Mary Jolls, he moved to Saratoga
County in 1790, where they continued to build a family. Mary's children, and
her age (n) at their birth: Olive (17), Mercy (19), John (20), Hale (27),
Jemima (28), Mary (29), Gideon (31), Sarah (37), Alvin (40), Julia (41),
Charlotte (43), and Samuel (44).
The unlikely fit of your four in there means Angalina would have been born to
Mary the same year as my Sarah, and Mary would have been 56 at George W.'s
birth, and possibly even older at Martha's. One might consider that with
Gideon's fecundity he may have fathered some children by other than his wife,
giving them his name. But he was renowned as a hard shell Baptist (see
newsletter), and with that reputation to defend this is unlikely. Likewise,
to place your four with Gideon, Jr. becomes a similar task. His marriage in
1821 leaves only George and Martha eligible.
Also enclosed is a letter (complete with my scribblings) I received (and
answered) from a Jean Robison of Coffeyville, KS, 12i years ago. She asks
about your same Mosher/Luther alliance of Saratoga and Madison counties. Why
not write her and see if she's still active; maybe you can help each other.
C 62 <>3 bhi
One other contact I can recommend is Emory Luther, 8808 West Pavia Street, Las
Vegas, Nevada 89117. Emory has been trying for thirty years to carry his
lineage back beyond: Emory^ (b. 1927); Laurance^ (b. Tioga, PA 1 Jan 1905);
Ernest^ (b. Tioga, PA 30 Dec 1881); Alonzo^ (b. Corning, NY 1856); and George''
?Washington Luther (b. 1808/15, d. 1884). Note the Tioga connection.
Please, please, advise me of your progress.
Yours truly.
George Luther
Enc. LFN 23.
Cc. Emory.
REGIONAL VICE PRESIDENTS
WESTERN STATES
Karen Luther Piazza
5422 Bartig Way
Citrus Heights, CA 95621
PLAINS STATES

I saw your listing of the Luther Family In America and decided to ask
for your help.
^ ^ j &3/
I have been working on my Mosher line for about ten years and have not
been able to find the parentage of m.y Gr. Grandfather Isaac born 1807
New York, possibly Saratogatown. ^
In eliminating some of the many Moshers living in Saratogatown at that
time I have come up with a David Mosher S David k Benjamin 3 Daniel 2
Hugh 1. David Jr. had a total of five sons born during the years of IBOO-
1825-30. ^
The only son who has been positively identified is.William G. born ca
â 18o6-7 Saratoga, died May 19, 1900 S. Hamilton, Madison co. , New York,
Death records identifies parents as David and Betsy .
^ 70 5 ^ ^ ^William G. married Mary Luther and married #2 Angelina' Lusher.
It is possible one of the sons could have been Rensselaer Mosher some
times referredto as S.R. born 1817 died 1893 and is buried in Niles
""Valley Gem. , Tioga Co. Pa. Rensselaer married Martha Luther.
David Jr. was in Saratoga 1807-10, Greenfield 1820-30, where (?) 1840,
Chatham^ Tioga Co. Pa. I850, Hamilton, Madison Co. New York i860. Th'e
first wife of David Jr. was Betsy born ca 1786 died April 25, I837
age 51 years, buried St. John Cem. Greenfield New York.
Was Betsy a Luther also?
David Jr. married #2 Sarah
I860. /
born about 1790 and still living in
In I850 David 69 and Sarah 51 were with son William G. and family. In
same household were\^^B. Mosher, could be B. Luther, instead of Mosher,
age 57, born Canada .^Gideon Luther age 32 born-New York. Gideon was
probably the brother of William Gs\ v/ife Mary age 36.-(.c (!"-
Mr. Luther I would really appreciate any help you can give me on this
Mosher, Luther line. I reasoned that if the first wife of David Jr. was
Betsy Luther, then you may have their children.
I have enclosed SASE for your convenience, and will look forward to your.
17^4/lfrVOK5-
Sincerely, Lfl) I ^
/>
Jean Robison
